landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Plaintiff is a tenant at 15 Mystic Street, Defendant is the owner/landlord and lessor of the rental unit, and Plaintiff pays monthly rent since May 1, 2022 (¶¶2–5). These factual allegations establish a landlord-tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant retained control/responsibility over common areas (¶6) and repeatedly failed to repair the broken main entry latch/lock after being notified (¶¶7–9, 14, 19), which constitutes an omission by the landlord.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Plaintiff alleges actual intrusions/theft (unknown person entered, tenants' packages taken, Plaintiff's package stolen) and evidence of unauthorized overnight occupancy in the basement, causing fear for personal safety and loss of use; she incurred out-of-pocket security expenses — facts that plausibly allege a material/substantial interference with quiet enjoyment (¶¶10–13, 15, 20).

causation.reasoning: Plaintiff alleges the insecure main entry (unrepaired after notice) allowed an unknown person to enter and steal packages and to occupy the basement; she links the theft, safety fears, and security expenditures directly to Defendant's failure to secure/repair the door (¶¶7–11, 13, 19–20), which adequately pleads causation.

damages.reasoning: Complaint specifies actual damages: stolen package (~$120), security camera and deadbolt (~$200), plus emotional distress, inconvenience, and loss of use; it also states an estimated total ($320) and seeks further relief (¶¶11, 13, 21–22). These allegations adequately plead damages.
